reviewText: Erbil (Irbil), and for that matter nearly all of Kurdish Iraq,  is entirely different from the remainder of Iraq now engulfed in sectarian violence, chaos, and bloodshed. Kurdistan is separate from Iraq historically, geographically, and politically. Their security, the Peshmerga, have sucessfully portected Kurdistan for the insurgent activity infecting central and southern Iraq. This 60 Minute excerpt is a valuable resource for anyone who is interested in a more balanced picture of Iraq than that to which we are exposed on the nightly network news.
